result.title: Computing 2D constrained Delaunay triangulation using the GPU
result.author: M Qi, TT Cao, TS Tan
result.proceeding: Proceedings of the ACM SIGGRAPH Symposium …
result.snippet: Abstract We propose the first GPU solution to compute the 2D constrained Delaunay triangulation (CDT) of a planar straight line graph (PSLG) consisting of points and edges. There are many CPU algorithms developed to solve the CDT problem in computational ...

result.title: A GPU Algorithm for 3D Convex Hull
result.author: M Gao, TT Cao, A Nanjappa, TS Tan, Z Huang
result.snippet: The implementation using the CUDA programming model on Nvidia GPUs is robust, exact, and efficient. The experiments show that it is up to an order of magnitude faster than other sequential convex hull implementations running on the CPU for inputs of millions of points ...
